intro: Anthistiria setosa, commonly known as the hairy anthistiria, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant is distinguished by its hairy stems and leaves, which give it its common name. It produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in spring, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Anthistiria setosa is often found in grasslands and rocky areas, thriving in well-drained soils.
